div.l: With othes grete he was sworen a doun
That he was holden wode in all þat toun
For euery clerke anōmne ryght helde withoþr
They seid þe man ys wode my lefe brother
And euery wight gan lawghe at þe stryf
Thus swyued was þe Carpenterz wyfe
For all his kepyng and his Ielousy
And Absolon hath kyssed her nethur yȝe
And nycolas ys scalded in the toute
This tale ys don god save all this Route .
Here endeth þe Mylners tale;
The Prolog of þᵉ Carpent̉er
Whan folke haue lawghen at þˢis nyse case
Of Absolon and hende Nycolas
Diủerse folke diủersely þey seid
But for þe more parte they lowgh and pleyed
Ne at his tale y sawh no man̄ hym greve
But hit were onely Oswold þe Reve
By cause he was of Carpenters crafte
A lytull yre in his herte lafte
He gan̄ to grucche and blamed hit a lyte
So the yk quoth he wel koude the quyte
With blerynge of a proude myllers yȝe
Yf that me lyste to speke of Rybaudry
But yke am old me lyste not pley for age
Grasse tyme ys don̄ my foder ys forage
This white top̄ wryteth myn̄ olde yeres
Myn herte ys also mowled as myn̄ heres
But yf y fare as doth an open̄ ars
That ilk frute ys eủer leng̉er þe wers
Tyll hit be Roten̄ in mullok or stree
We olde men̄ y drede so fare we
